intro: Noccaea gardeziana, commonly known as the Gardez stonecrop, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically has fleshy, succulent leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern, adapted to conserve water in arid environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale purple, and it produces small, rounded pods that contain several seeds. Noccaea gardeziana is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in full sun.
